qas.question: What happened to the dikes the Aztecs built?

answers.text: destroyed during the siege of Tenochtitlan

qas.question: Where does the lake still remain?

answers.text: municipality of Atenco, State of Mexico

qas.question: Who first built the dikes in Lake Texcoco?

answers.text: a system of interconnected salt and freshwater lakes

qas.question: Where is the lake located in Atenco?

context: Originally much of the valley laid beneath the waters of Lake Texcoco, <a3_0>a system of interconnected salt and freshwater lakes<a3_0/>. <a2_0>The Aztecs<a2_0/> built dikes to separate the fresh water used to raise crops in chinampas and to prevent recurrent floods. These dikes were <a0_0>destroyed during the siege of Tenochtitlan<a0_0/>, and during colonial times the Spanish regularly drained the lake to prevent floods. Only a small section of the original lake remains, located outside the <a4_0>Federal District<a4_0/>, in the <a1_0>municipality of Atenco, State of Mexico<a1_0/>.
